page.title: 04Our Church
page.content: St.Peter's, Church Langton, is a limestone and sandstone church. The lower part of the building dates from the late 13th century;the tower,naves and tall windows are 15th century;the roofing is Victorian. There are 8 bells in the tower. The oldest grave is dated 1695. The Hanbury's family grave has a carving of an angel. Some of Hanbury's trees are still growing in the Rectory garden. The Rectory and Churchyard were used in a recent T.V. dramatisation of C.P.Snow's "Strangers and Brothers". The church is a cross shape. Most of the windows are stained glass, telling Bible stories. The church furniture is wooden with decorative carvings. The oldest tomb, that of Richard Roberts,a knight,is dated 1644. In the late 17th century Roundheads chopped the fingers, nose and toes off the statue on the tomb.
